network sniffing will most likely require an agent for the database.

The only answer will be C.
this question is weirdly worded, i have to re-read it several times

questions.question_text: The InfoSec team has directed compliance database activity monitoring without agents on a hosted database server in the public IaaS. Which of the following configurations is needed to ensure this requirement is achieved?

questions.question_text:
Ann. a user, has tried to connect to a VM hosted in a private cloud using her directory services credentials. After three attempts, she realizes the keyboard was set to German instead of English, and she was typing "z" instead of "y". After fixing this issue, Ann is still unable to log in; however, other users can access the VM.
Which of the following is the MOST likely cause?

A cloud administrator is integrating account logins with Facebook, LinkedIn, and Twitter for marketing and to increase market presence using social media platforms. Given this scenario, which of the following components are needed to match these requirements? (Select two).

discussion.content: An explanation would be nice for this one. I'll have to return to it if I have time.
Right answer is A
Need a convincing reason why it wouldn't be A.

A. 02:00-04:00

There's no reason to run a load test while the critical system is available to users. The test itself creates the load on the system. usually, this is done in a similar PROD environment but here they are going straight to the source so the only available time slot will be A.
I think it's A because it says in the question :"To minimize the effect to the existing system"
You dont want to do a load test during mission critical hours. The answer is A since it is outside of all ERP hours.
It is a load test you need people on the system and load on the systems to test it
can someone explain the rational to this answer? I would expect it to be outisde mission critical operations window and outside batch jobs.

comments.content: I think we need load test when all systems are on. So C is correct
If C is correct, then B is also correct following your argument. I think the correct answer is A. There is nothing going on at that time and there will be no impact on the critical system.

questions.question_text:
A company uses its own private cloud, which has few available resources. Mission-critical systems and other information systems are running on it. A new system will be deployed on the private cloud. The following tests are included in the test plan:
✑ Load test (2h)
✑ Backup/restore test (6h)
✑ Functional test (8h)
✑ Failover test (1h)
The work schedule of the existing system is shown below.
//IMG//

To minimize the effect to the existing system, which of the following schedules is MOST suitable for the load test?

questions.answer_description: In an IaaS model, the client typically wouldn't be managing the hypervisors themselves. They would manage the guests on top of the hypervisors. If you are deploying OS patches, you would be patching guest operating systems.

choices.A: Using a patch management system, identify the hypervisor type, select a group of hypervisors to be patched, and perform a rolling application of patches.
choices.D: Using a patch management system, identify the services that require patching, and select and apply the patches.
choices.B: Using a patch management system, identify the guests that require patching, and select and apply the patches.
choices.C: Using a patch management system, identify the applications needing the patch, select the required application in a patch management console, and apply the patches.

comments.content: I agree it is B, the question asks for OS patch which would be the guest not the hypervisor.

discussion.content: Correct answer is B. In IaaS, you don't know the underlying hypervisor specifics...question calls out OS level patches so you would apply those per guest instance.

B. 

Guest operating system.
To identify the hypervisor type, you would be going beyond IaaS into a bare metal server instance. Answer is B, identify the guests that require patching.

questions.question_text: In an IaaS model, to which of the following methodologies would the client apply a list of OS patches, assuming approval from CAB has been given?
